headline: Best Fried Green Tomatoes
description: Fried green tomatoes are a quick and easy way to use up green tomatoes and make a wonderful late summer treat.

video.description: Golden and crispy on the outside yet tender and juicy on the inside, fried green tomatoes really are something else. Find out how to make this Southern dish at home along with a delicious remoulade recipe that rounds out the perfect appetizer.
video.name: How to Make the Best Fried Green Tomatoes

name: Best Fried Green Tomatoes

recipeInstructions.text: Slice tomatoes 1/2 inch thick. Discard the ends.

Whisk eggs and milk together in a medium-size bowl. Scoop flour onto a plate. Mix cornmeal, bread crumbs and salt and pepper on another plate. Dip tomatoes into flour to coat. Then dip the tomatoes into milk and egg mixture. Dredge in breadcrumbs to completely coat.

In a large skillet, pour vegetable oil (enough so that there is 1/2 inch of oil in the pan) and heat over a medium heat. Place tomatoes into the frying pan in batches of 4 or 5, depending on the size of your skillet. Do not crowd the tomatoes, they should not touch each other.
When the tomatoes are browned, flip and fry them on the other side. Drain them on paper towels.

review.reviewBody: I used a mandoline slicer and cut the tomatoes 6-7mm (~0.25") thick. I didn't discard the non-stem end but I used a super sharp knife to shave the peel from a circle at the end to provide a ring of peel like the other slices have. I used what apparently were green "beefsteak" tomatoes because they were a good 4" in diameter and two tomatoes were enough to take up all of the cornmeal/breadcrumb mix. This was the first time I've succeeded in making fried green tomatoes as in my previous attempts the breading fell off. These were perfect and took me back to those Cajun restaurants I've been to years ago that served them. Although I didn't make any, these would have paired perfectly with a spicy remoulade sauce.
Followed your recipe and tomatoes came out wonderful for being my first time making fry green tomatoes. Loved it

Delicious, first off- not a cook, I fix forklifts. That being said, I used "on hand ingredients" ...wheat flower, jiffy brand corn muffin mix with Cajun seasoning, and like one of your other reviewers garlic powder. I cooked it outside on my neighbors porta-stove, and HFS... it smelled like the fair! Mind you it's December, I tried this because I took out a plant from the yard, and the wife even loved them!!! Jalapeño cheddar grits used to be my "go to" ... not so sure about that now!!! THANKS!!!
It was the best. This site is the best . I've tried multiple recipes on here and they were good!
I made these this evening. They were delicious!
I did everything except I used about a 3/16 inch of Avacado oil, didn't want to waste so much oil and it was easy to flip to get both sides fried golden brown.
Excellent easy recipe. Thank you.
great recipe!
Solid Recipe. Just like the ones you get at the restaurants in Charleston. Pick a good remoulade, or creative seafood topping and you will not be disappointed.

These were absolutely delicious. Added a kicky Cajun seasoning and a little extra garlic powder to the panko-cornmeal, and cut my tomatos about a quarter inch thin. I’m not a super fryer, but following those steps to coat the sliced tomatoes produced crisp, tangy, juicy fried green tomatoes that are absolutely addictive. I’ll be making these again.
I didnt make any changes although next batch im going to try a spice not sure which one yet.
Delicious
What a great recipe! Everyone loved them!
They were good they turn out right. I will keep on making them this way.
Omg so good!!! Nom Nom!!

Amazing!!! Sooo perfect! Can’t get enough! Next year I need to plant more tomato plants. Even without dip they are fantastic, tangy, bold, indescribably delicious. They fry so fast. Supper easy to make.

Received two gorgeous homegrown green tomatoes from a relative. Used this recipe EXACTLY (cutting ingredient amounts by half) and they turned out FANTASTIC! I made a dipping sauce with sour cream, and a little Thai sweet chili sauce, which was a great complement to the fried tomatoes. This recipe is a KEEPER, and I will make again soon!
I used crushed rice krispie for bread crumbs, oat brand instead of corn meal, and gluten free flour. Delicious1
Fantastic and crispy goodness
I mix mayonaise and hot sauce for a dipping sauce. Yum!

I grew up eating fried green tomatoes! I also have a lot of tomatoes in the garden 😍 this was the best! I didnt have milk so i used coconut milk, Italian breadcrumbs, splash of lemon pepper, Paprika, cayenne, garlic powder 😍 the crunch sweetness/spice perfect thx they didnt last long!

I enjoyed the simplicity of this recipe along with the professional style and taste. I combined all dry ingredients (in error) then after drudging from dry mix to egg mix to separate bread crumbs (crushed cornbread stuffing) to dry mix then finally to the hot oil.
Yummy! No changes! They were delicious. Love those green fryes.

I love fried green tomatoes. I usually make them "express" which foe me means flour, cornmeal, salt & sugar, dredge then fry. My daughter & I would eat them as we cooked them. So I decided to try this recipe & I love the crunch of the panko crumbs. I started them in the skillet until browning started then finished them in the airfryer. They where perfectly crunchy outside and chewy inside. Also used almond milk because I do not buy cows milk. I like salt & a sprinkle for a sweet & salty crunchy vibe. Great recipe though.
Fantastic recipe I used cayenne and smoked paprika because of love a little heart dipping them in ranch was phenomenal
Very good recipe, no did not make any changes
I followed the recipe exactly and they were delicious! Thank you! 😋 Wish I had taken a photo but we ate them all. Lol.
Wonderful recipe. I used italian breadcrumbs and added grated parmesean. It was delicious!

I love it! I had to make once slight alteration…I dipped in egg mixture, then flour, then egg mixture again, then cornmeal mixture. This is my first time making these, and I will continue to make them using this recipe!
This was awesome! The only thing different I did was not use breadcrumbs. These came out perfect for us and we will be using this recipe from here on out.
WELL worth the small effort of making these are they didn’t last two minutes with our little party that we had, absolutely wonderful!!!

I loved this recipe, I omitted the breadcrumbs and because my husband loves spice I sprinkled cayenne pepper on the tomatoes first and preceded with your directions. It was absolutely delicious and my husband enjoyed every one 😊 Thanks for sharing it.
They fry up fast. Great tasting! Dipped them in ranch dressing. Looking forward to making them again.
Loved it, came out perfect
Perfect! Nice crisp breading. I substituted coconut oil for vegetable oil. Thanks a bunch! I'll be using this again.

I've been using this recipe since I was in college (in the late 90s/early 2000s) and probably found it here. I've tried other recipes since, but this is hands down my favorite Fried Green Tomatoes recipe. I'll eat the whole batch if I don't stop myself.
Tasty and crunchy.
Delicious! I usually wait until the end of the season to make fried green tomatoes. These were so good, next year I will pick green tomatoes just to make these!
it was perfect...
Loved it!!!!!
The only thing I did different was add a pinch more salt and pepper and a half tsp of garlic powder. Super easy and delicious!!!

Delicious !!! The proportions for everything are perfect. The only changes I made were cutting the tomatoes thinner (personal preference) and double-battering the tomatoes (one more time in the flour/cornmeal and egg before I put in the breadcrumbs). Served with a dip of 3 parts mayo to one parts siracha, and a little sambal oekel. 

Remember to use dry hand wet hand technique to keep your hands clean!! I hope anyone reading this has a lovely day.
DELICIOUS....I MUST SAY SO....
Yummy! Worked out perfectly! I added cajun seasoning and used almond milk instead of cow milk. Love the thickness. We dipped it in buffalo sauce I had already. But they were good without it too.
I sliced the tomatoes 1/8” thick. Super yummy!!
Delicious! I just used egg white instead of the whole egg. They were crispy and delicious. Requests were made to cut back the salt and add some garlic the next time.
It was easy and delicious! I also used panko and flour because I am out of corn meal. Next time I think I'll add garlic powder

Oh.my.word. This recipe . . . I searched for the best Fried Green Tomatoes and this was it! The only thing I did differently was use Panko that I had on hand instead of regular bread crumbs.
This recipe turned out way better than I imagined it would. A huge hit! 
I had a lot of flour and milk/egg mixture left over so next time I plan to use half the amount of those ingredients and maybe increase the seasoned Panko/cornmeal mixture (I used stone-ground cornmeal.) This is absolutely my new go-to Fried Green Tomatoes recipe!

I made this exactly as it is. I didn’t enjoy them at all. Half inch was too thick for my liking. Frying thick tomatoes on medium was impossible for me to do-not hot enough and just sucked the oil in. The corn meal was hard and gritty and other than the tomato tartness there was not much flavor at all. I can’t understand the high number or reviews.
They were absolutely delicious. The buttermilk and cornmeal were key components!
Terrible recipe. Flour from the first step does not stay on during the egg/milk step. Then the corn meal does not stick to the egg/milk. Put them into the hot oil and it all comes off. Worthless.
The recipe & directions were perfect. They came out deliciously crispy.
It was good

These turned out really well! Great recipe. My tomatoes were a little too ripe so I cut out the seeds and they weren’t mushy at all. Light and flavorful. Thanks! Do you have a recipe for a good spicy dipping sauce?
Yum! Yum! Yum! Much better than the ones from the actual Whistle Stop Cafe in GA! (I've eaten there.)
Instead of meal I used seasoned fish fry and omitted any others seasoning.

I NEVER leave reviews of recipes because normally they are good, but not out of this world. These fried green tomatoes are AMAZING. I am a food snob and am quick to judge but these are outstanding. I did however use buttermilk instead of milk so that might have made a difference. My personal opinion, use the buttermilk. You won’t regret it. Dip them in some bbq’sauce mixed with honey mustard and you’ll be in hog heaven.

Excellent recipe. Breading stayed on, they came out perfect. The mix of cornmeal and breadcrumbs gives it the exact texture you usually find in restaurants. I served them with ranch, because, well, that's just what we do. Delicious! And the fact that the tomatoes came right out of my garden made them even better!

My family loved these. My husband is from the south and he looks his green tomatoes very simple, seasoned with salt and pepper, and this recipe is exactly how he likes them. I had to double dip the tomatoes in the egg wash to make the batter stick to it but other than that I followed the recipe exactly as it was.

I have made this recipe twice now and its amazing!! I do cut my tomatoes very thin (probably 1/4 inch) and they come out so crispy and flavorful. The batter ratio is perfect and it's so easy! You can sprinkle with some Tony's for a little spice! I honestly can't understand the reviews that are any less than 4 stars!!!

I made these fried green tomatoes just the way the recipe called for. I did add my own seasonings. They came out fantastic. I used the left over eggs, milk and the breading, added a tsp of baking powder and made some great fritters. This is my new favorite recipe. Thanks!

I really liked the recipe. But It made a LOT of extra batter, and I also had leftover eggs.. I'd say this is more for 6-7 tomatoes. I also added garlic powder and onion powder to my powder mixture and I used a mix of peppercorns (red, white, greven and black ) for a fuller flavor. 

I did have the same problem I always seem to have whenever I havTorry anything on the stove top, all the batter seemed to fall off and go into the oil and then the oil burned essentially before the tomatoes were done cooking.
Made these tonight and my family fell in love with them. They were crunchy and tasty. We will be adding garlic powder to the dry mix next time but otherwise perfect.
Excellent! great texture and presentation.

This recipe is great just like it is! I made no changes (which is what I do when I first make a recipe). Usually i will make my changes according to how the recipe turns out the first time, but I can honestly say that there is nothing I could do to make this any better than it is! Definitely 5 stars!
very good! i followed the suggestion to only use egg whites with the milk. they fried up quickly and were crip but not oily.
Delicious! Best recipe for green tomatoes, crispy and well seasoned.

I’ve had them many times, but never made them because I don’t like to fry in the house often. These taste like home. 
I used panko bread crumbs with corn meal, because that’s all I had. I like a kick to things, so I added some Tony’s to the bread crumbs. 
Next time I will try baking as one reviewer did. I wanted to be as true as I could be to the original recipe the first go round. Next time I will use one egg and half the milk. Thank you for the recipe.
I loved these tomatoes! They came out perfectly crispy and crunchy and everyone loved them! Definitely saving this recipe.

Sorry, I made some changes. I followed Chef John's suggestion of salting the slices for about 20 min to draw out the moisture. Next, you do not need a quart of oil. Just generously cover the bottom of your pan. Per other reviewers, I also added a couple TB butter. I also reduced the flour to 1/2 cup, and added some garlic powder and Laawrys. I fried for approx 2 min per side. They fried up and browned perfectly. Great recipe.
My picky children loved these!
These are easy and delicious. I cut the slices about 1/4/ inch thick to a bit more.

It was great! This is the second time I made this recipe & it was delicious both times. I had a sandwich like this @ Ground Zero in Clarksdale, MS. The tomatoes were served on a sub bun, topped with mozzarella cheese & bacon. YUMMMM! Which is exactly how I made them!
Made this recipe exactly as written with green tomatoes from our garden. Turned out perfect.
I loved it just the way it was written!

I made these following many of previous reviewers recommendations (thank you!!). I soaked the tomato slices in 16 ozs. of buttermilk for 5-10 minutes (in a ziplock bag-so easy) as I wanted to bake them (400*F 40 mins, flip half way through) for a healthier version. I used half the amount of flour. I poured some of the buttermilk out of the ziplock bag into a small bowl, so after I floured the tomato slices I dipped them in buttermilk again before adding on the Panko/corn meal mix. I would definitely add some spices to the flour mix next time (garlic powder, onion powder, a little chili powder or maybe even adobo). We had some leftover BBQ dipping sauce and tried that but it overpowered the tomato flavor, so I would definitely cut back any dipping ingredient (BBQ sauce, Hot mustard, hot pepper relish) with sour cream to tone down its flavor a bit so it doesn’t overpower the tomato slices. First times having these and they were a hit!
The best I've tasted. For a kick, I added a 1/4 tsp. of Old Bay seasoning....because I'm from Baltimore.
Disappointed. Followed recipe. Very bland.
It was ok. I would definitely slice the tomatoes thinner. I used one fried green tomato as kind of a vegetarian burger in a bun with cheese and garlic ailoi and that was quite good.

First time I’ve made fried green tomatoes and they turned out perfectly! I lightly salted the tomatoes as I took them out of the oil with pink Himalayan salt. Soo good! Even my 3 year old liked them! Win!!!

These were surprisingly good. I have never eaten green tomatoes before. I added garlic powder to the dry ingredients and only used panko as I did not have any cornmeal 
I found you definitely needed more of the bread crumb mixture than what was suggested.

My parents loved to make fried green tomatoes while I was growing up. They simply dipped them in flour and fried them and then made a milk gravy to serve over top of them. I made this recipe exactly as directed except I used soy flour in place of wheat flour (my husband is diabetic so that cuts the carbs a bit) and I didn’t deep fry, but only sautéed in olive oil and a little butter. The result was better than my former fried green tomatoes— the batter coated nicely and there was a nice crunchy texture from the corn meal!! This is how I will make this dish from now on!!

This is probably the very best fried green tomato recipe I've ever made! Unbelievably delicious! After I cut my tomatoes I set them on paper towels to dry them out. That seemed to help the flower, egg and cornmeal mixture stick better. We will definitely make this again!
This was a simple recipe to follow. The video helped
Just like mamma made them. The only change I made was to fry them in lard instead of vegetable oil, since I had one and not the other. So good.
Sooo good! These were perfect!
Delicious my first time making and eating and now I have an idea for fried chicken thanks will use this recipe again!
Super easy to make. I followed the recipe exactly except I couldn't find green tomatoes and used less ripe red tomatoes. My boyfriend, who asked me to fry tomatoes, was very happy.
Super easy to make. I followed the recipe exactly except I couldn't find green tomatoes and used less ripe red tomatoes. My boyfriend, who asked me to fry tomatoes, was very happy.

Would have given 5 stars but didn't include the remoulade. These were amazing. I even goofed and added the flour to the rest of the dry ingredients. I scraped out what flour I could find and put it on a separate plate. Easy to make. Thank you for posting!

I made this recipe as written. I thought it was good but it tasted somewhat similar to my normal way of making fried green tomatoes. I will stick with my normal way since my normal way has fewer steps.

Very easy to make and so tasty. I might have even sliced my tomatoes thicker but turned out with a nice tang. Added some onion powder for added flavor. My sister in law use to make them for my brother.
This is a simple, but delicious recipe. I followed it exactly and it turned out great.
This was my first attempt at fried green tomatoes and they were delicious. I followed the recipe exactly and they tuned out great.
Very simple and they turned out perfect!!
Easy! Made them for the first time ever, and this recipe was easy-peasy! Yum!
these are the best. Love love love them!
My first time making or eating fried green tomatoes. They are very good! I had panko so I used that for the bread crumbs. I will definitely make it again.

This is, by far, the best fried green tomato recipe. The crust adheres to the tomato after frying and there is no improvement necessary. We used to go to a restaurant outside of Marco Island, FL, Pelican Bend, on the Isles of Capri. They served Fried Blue Tomatoes. Fry, and while warm, add blue cheese to melt. So, so good. Thank you for sharing this recipe.
